intro: Theodorea serrata, commonly known as the serrated theodorea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Theodorea serrata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrant blooms.
